div.p: MS found with a specimen of Sapindaceae (MEL 2251103). Maytown

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Queensland
MS annotation by M, Haynes's writing being unclear: 'QL'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Wd Dr Mueller kindly examine the accompanying (by Parcel Post) Specimen of "a Creeper" vine , growing luxuriantly on spot's in the Palmer River" at Maytown. Mr M. Haynes (Barrister at Law) fellow-passenger with Dr Mueller from Melbourne as far as Eden (on the Drs way to botanise the Maneroo District
i.e. Monaro District, NSW. See M to W. Hooker, 17 September 1860 (in this edition as 60-09-17a), and M to R. Heales, 10 January 1861. in 1860) makes the request, that Dr M. wd communicate with him; & state, if the "pollen" or powder, (shaken by Mr H. from the pod; by squeezing, & dusting) is of any medical or other use; as Mr H. has found it a most powerfully persistent "bitter" to the tongue.

I enclose also branch of "thick foliaged "stunted" "Tree" same "habitat". affording grand "shade" by "dark rifle-green" front of leaf (& called by "Bushmen" from its valuelessness , " shitten
wood "). Specimens enclosed from three (3) different localities here. MH.
